section.title: Practice: read only file server
section.para: 1. Create a directory in a good location (FHS) to share files for everyone to read.
2. Make sure the directory is owned properly and is world accessible.
3. Put a textfile in this directory
5. Verify from your own and from another computer (smbclient, net use, ...) that the share is accessible for reading.
6. Make a backup copy of your smb.conf, name it smb.conf.ReadOnlyFileServer.

section.title: Solution: read only file server
section.para: 1. Create a directory in a good location (FHS) to share files for everyone to read.
2. Make sure the directory is owned properly and is world accessible.
3. Put a textfile in this directory
section.screen:
You smb.conf.readonly could look like this: [global] workgroup = WORKGROUP server string = Read Only File Server netbios name = STUDENTx security = share
[readonly] path = /srv/samba/readonly comment = read only file share read only = yes guest ok = yes
test with testparm before going in production!
section.para: 5. Verify from your own and from another computer (smbclient, net use, ...) that the share is accessible for reading.
section.screen: On Windows Explorer: browse to My Network Places
On Windows cmd.exe: net use L: //studentx/readonly
section.para: 6. Make a backup copy of your smb.conf, name it smb.conf.ReadOnlyFileServer.
